resources.string: A \"red trail\" in mountain hiking is a designated path through the mountains marked with red-colored trail markers, providing a route for hikers to follow. These markers are strategically placed along the trail to ensure clear navigation and help hikers stay on the designated path. Red trails are part of a trail system that may include various difficulty levels, connecting key points of interest, viewpoints, and providing access to the natural beauty of the mountainous landscape. Hikers can follow the red trail markers to explore and enjoy the scenic and challenging aspects of the mountains.
